cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north tonight and then accelerate north-northeastward Wednesday–Friday, hugging the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of St. Marys River, GA to South Santee River, SC (current watch area—well south of the port).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys and Florida west coast from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River (current warning area).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida Big Bend through New England is within the 5-day cone.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port according to current surge graphic.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Friday with isolated higher totals in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents in the New York Bight ahead of and during the storm’s passage.
